intro: Ternstroemia amistadensis, commonly known as the Amistad ternstroemia, is a flowering plant species native to the cloud forests of Central America. It belongs to the family Theaceae, which includes camellias and other ornamental shrubs. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
